title: 5 effective Korean beauty tools to use at home: LED masks, facial massagers and more  | Vogue India
text: To revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved stories To revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved stories By Hasina Jeelani On days when you are feeling too lazy to go to the salon, you will want to allow the world of Korean beauty tools and skincare to come to your rescue. From innovative massaging tools to advanced light therapy masks, you’ll find the latest advancements in the world of technology placed in the palm of your hands—and here are the ones that you’ll want to bookmark for your next weekend at-home skincare rituals: Sheet masks are so 2000-and-late, the new must-haves within the world of skincare are headlined by LED masks for inviting some light therapy into your routine that exposes your skin to different wavelengths of light—such as red for moisturising and elasticity and blue for soothing skin concerns. CELLRETURN LED Mask (Platinum) Bring the salon home with mini facial massagers that will help restore vitality and firmness to ageing skin. Employing vertical vibrations, these handy massagers can be used to aid muscle firmness to counteract age-related sagging skin as well as ensuring deeper penetration of your skincare actives. Vanav UP6 Facial Massager If you are looking to combat puffiness after a midnight ramen binge, you will want a pair of face rollers—or ten—by your side. The strangely satisfying sensation of kneading your face comes with a side helping of smoother skin, better circulation and brighter complexion. What’s not to love? SinLoon Face Massager After all, why should your face have all the fun? The same principles of facial rollers have been finding increasing takers within the world of body care, with the world of Korean beauty tools replicating the same kneading techniques employed by professional aestheticians to firm the skin around the torso, thighs and arms. ReFa For Body It is time to level up your sheet mask game with options that target specific areas of the face. Chin masks are taking the landscape of Seoul skincare with their face sculpting capabilities. Designed to be worn as a chin strap that hooks behind the ears, this V-shaped mask can be worn for adding firmness to a sagging jawline.
